alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis; Koochiching; North Itasca; Northern Aitkin; Pine; South Aitkin; South Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 08 at 1:59AM CDT until October 09 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 possible. * WHERE...Koochiching, North Itasca, South Itasca, Northern Aitkin, South Aitkin, Carlton and South St. Louis and Pine Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Fond du Lac Band, the Mille Lacs Band, East Lake, Lena Lake, Big Sandy Lake and, Hinckley areas and the Bois Forte Band, Deer Creek and, Nett Lake areas. * WHEN...From late tonight through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas near Lake Superior will be warmer. There are also concerns about cloud cover tonight which would impact temperatures. We currently expect some clearing, if clouds remain more widespread then warmer temperatures would occur.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Carlton, South St. Louis; Koochiching; North Itasca; Northern Aitkin; Pine; South Aitkin; South Itasca
